{{Infobox comedian | name = Billy Gardell | image = | caption = | birth_name = William Gardell | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1969|8|20}} | birth_place = [[Pittsburgh]], [[Pennsylvania]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | body_discovered = | resting_place = | nationality = [[United States|American]] | spouse = Patty Knight (2001–present) | domestic_partner = | children = William | parents = | website = | signature = }} '''William Gardell''' (born August 20, 1969) is an American stand-up comedian, actor, game show host and voice artist. Gardell played [[Chicago]] police officer Mike Biggs on ''[[Mike & Molly]].'' He also made an appearance in a dozen episodes of ''[[My Name Is Earl]]'' as a police officer.<ref>{{cite news|last=Fink|first=Jerry|url=http://www.lasvegassun.com/news/2009/jul/01/face-you-might-know-tv-appear-onstage/|title=Face you might know from TV to appear onstage|date=2009-07-01|publisher=lasvegassun.com|accessdate=2013-02-03}}</ref> Gardell voiced [[Santa Claus|Santa]] in ''[[Ice Age: A Mammoth Christmas]]'', as well as starring on ''[[Sullivan & Son]]'' in the recurring role of Lyle Winkler.
==Early life== Born in [[Swissvale, Pennsylvania]], near [[Pittsburgh]],<ref>[http://www.pittsburghmagazine.com/Pittsburgh-Magazine/December-2010/Billy-Gardell/ Billy Gardell]</ref> Gardell attended [[Winter Park High School]] in [[Orange County, Florida]] during 1985.<ref name="OrlandoSentinel-2011">{{cite news|last=Boedeker|first=Hal|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2011-12-29/entertainment/os-billy-gardell-orlando-20111229_1_billy-gardell-mike-molly-molly-flynn|title=Mike & Molly & standup - Billy Gardell returns home to help Central Florida welcome the new year|date=2011-12-29|publisher=orlandosentinel.com|accessdate=2013-02-03}}</ref> As a child, he moved to Florida with his mother and younger brother and sister after his parents divorced. After that, he only visited Pennsylvania in the summers.<ref name="USAToday-2011">{{cite news|last=Mills|first=Nancy|url=https://www.usatoday.com/life/people/2011-02-05-billy-gardell_N.htm|title=The small things in life are big enough for Billy Gardell|date=2011-02-05|publisher=usatoday.com|accessdate=2013-02-03}}</ref> He has said living in Florida was a positive experience.<ref name="OrlandoSentinel-2001">{{cite news|last=Anderson|first=Jamie J.|url=http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/2001-07-13/entertainment/0107120369_1_billy-gardell-bonkerz-comedian|title=Daydream's Punchline Is Oh-so-sweet - Did You Hear The One About An Orlando Comedian Who Works Hard For His Success?|date=2001-07-13|publisher=orlandosentinel.com|accessdate=2013-02-03}}</ref> At the age of 15, he started working at a department store warehouse in the receiving area where he would unload trucks and stack pallets.<ref name="USAToday-2011" /> In 1987, he started cleaning bathrooms, seating people, and answering phones at a local comedy club, Bonkerz.<ref name="OrlandoSentinel-2011" /> On December 28, he started performing at the comedy club's open-mic nights after he made a dare with some co-workers. "If I didn't do an open mic night, I couldn't cover the bet. I was running my mouth that I would do it. They bet me I wouldn't," he explained. He eventually started opening for [[Dennis Miller]] and [[George Carlin]].<ref name="USAToday-2011" />
Gardell was a member of [[International Thespian Society]] Troupe 850 whose other notable alumni include [[Amanda Bearse]], also a graduate of Winter Park High School, and [[Ben Rock]] of ''[[The Blair Witch Project]]''.<ref>{{cite news|last=Garisto|first=Julie|url=http://m.cltampa.com/tampa/mollys-better-half/Content?oid=2271516|title=Molly's better half|date=2011-05-12|publisher=cltampa.com|accessdate=2013-02-03}}</ref>
==Career== Gardell is known for his comedic roles and is influenced by [[Jackie Gleason]].<ref name="USAToday-2011" /> He has also listed [[Richard Pryor]], [[George Carlin]], [[John Candy]],<ref>{{cite news|last=Duck|first=Allison|url=http://www.lasvegasweekly.com/news/2011/jul/06/comedian-billy-gardell-hits-halftime/|title=Comedian Billy Gardell hits ‘Halftime’|date=2011-07-06|publisher=lasvegasweekly.com|accessdate=2013-02-03}}</ref> and [[John Belushi]] as his influences.<ref>{{cite news|last=Oldenburg|first=Ann|url=http://usatoday30.usatoday.com/life/people/story/2011-10-02/Billy-Gardell-Mike-amp-Molly-Melissa-McCarthy/50637080/1|title='Mike & Molly' star Billy Gardell is one happy husband|date=2011-10-03|publisher=usatoday.com|accessdate=2013-02-03}}</ref> Although Bonkerz helped launch his comedy career, he has credited the support from his grandmother, saying "She told me when I was 8 years old that I could be a comic".<ref name="OrlandoSentinel-2001" /> Before ''Mike & Molly'', Gardell revealed that he considered a career in radio after being on the road for his comedy act began to affect his family time.<ref name="USAToday-2011" /> He has performed in several feature films, including ''[[Bad Santa]]'' (with [[Billy Bob Thornton]]) ''[[You, Me, and Dupree]]'' (with [[Owen Wilson]]) and ''[[Avenging Angelo]]'' (with [[Sylvester Stallone]] and [[Anthony Quinn]]) as well as appearing numerous times in recurring roles in several US television series, including [[NBC]]'s ''[[Heist (TV series)|Heist]]'', ''[[The Practice]]'', ''[[Yes, Dear]]'', ''[[Desperate Housewives]]'', ''[[Lucky (TV series)|Lucky]]'', ''[[Bones (TV series)|''Bones'']]'', ''[[My Name Is Earl]]'', ''[[Monk (TV series)|Monk]]'', and ''[[The King of Queens]]''. Gardell appeared as himself on the [[Comedy Central]] series ''[[Make Me Laugh]]''. Subsequently, he appeared on Miller’s television program ''Dennis Miller'', telecast on the US financial news network [[CNBC]] (conducting "man-on-the-street" interviews). Notably, he created and staged a ''[[Saturday Night Live|SNL]]''-style charity performance of a piece called ''Winter Park Live'', the proceeds from which were donated to [[Comic Relief (charity)|Comic Relief]].
Gardell continues to make weekly appearances on hometown local radio station, [[WDVE]], appearing on ''[[The DVE Morning Show]]''.<ref>{{cite news|last=Owen|first=Rob|url=http://www.post-gazette.com/stories/ae/tv-radio/billy-gardell-relishes-role-in-mike-molly-264663/|title=Billy Gardell relishes role in 'Mike & Molly'|date=2012-03-29|publisher=post-gazette.com|accessdate=2013-02-03}}</ref> Gardell also appeared on ''[[Chelsea Lately]]'', as a roundtable participant. Gardell appeared on a special for ''[[Comedy Central Presents]]'' in 2007 that aired on April 4, 2008. Gardell also played the host of ''Pizza Talk'', an imaginary TV series, in commercials for [[Round Table Pizza]].
In 2006, Gardell's first comedy album, ''Billy Gardell: Throwback'', was released.<ref name="WatertownDaily-2011">{{cite news|last=Brock|first=Chris|url=http://www.watertowndailytimes.com/article/20111009/CURR04/710099861|title=Billy Gardell in Clayton Oct. 14|date=2011-10-09|publisher=watertowndailytimes.com|accessdate=2013-02-03}}</ref>
From September 2010 to May 2016, Gardell starred in ''[[Mike & Molly]]'', alongside [[Melissa McCarthy]].
In November 2011, he lent his voice to [[Santa Claus|Santa]] in ''[[Ice Age: A Mammoth Christmas]]''.
His new stand-up special ''Halftime'' was released in 2011 and aired on [[Comedy Central]]. It was filmed in Pittsburgh and profiles working-class America.<ref name="WatertownDaily-2011" /> As of 2011, he continues to tour as a stand-up comedian in addition to acting.<ref name="OrlandoSentinel-2011" /> In a 2011 ''[[Orlando Sentinel]]'' article, Gardell said he wouldn't mind doing movies again.<ref name="OrlandoSentinel-2011" />
In 2015, Gardell started hosting the lottery game show ''[[Monopoly Millionaires' Club (TV series)|Monopoly Millionaires' Club]]'', featuring contestants who bought tickets for the ''[[Monopoly Millionaires' Club]]'' lottery game; the latter began on October 19, 2014.
==Personal life== Gardell has been married to Patty Knight since 2001.<ref name="OrlandoSentinel-2001" /><ref name="WatertownDaily-2011" /> They have a 13-year old son, William as of 2016. In a 2011 ''[[USA Today]]'' article, Gardell said he may retire when his son is a teenager to spend more time with him.<ref name="USAToday-2011" /> His parents still live in Florida where he occasionally visits them.<ref name="OrlandoSentinel-2011" /> Regarding his weight, Gardell has explained that he "always had a little gut" and weighed 350 pounds at one point.<ref name="USAToday-2011" /> Gardell is allergic to dogs.<ref>{{Cite episode |title=[[The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]] |network= [[CBS]] |date=2014-05-13 |season=10 |number=1928 |language=English}}</ref>
Gardell is a [[Pittsburgh Steelers]] fan, having participated in several [[Terrible Towel]] waves with [[Steeler Nation|other Steeler fans]] at [[Heinz Field]]. His favorite player growing up was [[Jack Lambert (American football)|Jack Lambert]], with his son liking former Steeler [[Hines Ward]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Varley|first=Teresa|url=http://www.steelers.com/news/article-1/Talking-Steelers-Football-with-Billy-Gardell/8b39929e-4883-4c40-a40b-c5add9af2b97|title=Talking Steelers Football with Billy Gardell|date=2011-11-16|publisher=steelers.com|accessdate=2013-02-03}}</ref>
